content.question:
At a small company, <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of the employees are classified as junior level, and <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of the employees work in department A. Of those classified as junior level, <math alttext="55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent work in department A. One employee will be selected at random.
What is the probability that the selected employee works in department A and is not classified as junior level?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
